page.title: 03The Sheep Farmer 2
page.content: {Question}What do you do when the sheep get covered in snow? {Answer}If the sheep get covered in snow I just have to look for them and find as many as I can.If the sheep get enough room to move about they can stay alive a long time.They look for shelter themselves.That sort of thing doesn't happen very often.There was a bad winter in the early sixties and then last year,but it's only every 15 to 20 years that it's a problem. {Question}How many sheep die? {Answer}About 150 every year.Usually it's ticks that kills them or hoodie crows and foxes at lambing time. I shoot them if I see them. {Question}How much does a sheep cost? {Answer}A ram is about Â£100 a sheep is about Â£70 and a lamb is worth about Â£20.
